The various acts in which original lordship CH.xx111- may be exercised are next reviewed ; and here, as in xxxm. book i. the chief interest centres in the act of giving.

This, it is explained, does not imply the transfer-

ence of the entire right to possess the thing given.

As in God's giving, so in the state of innocence, to

give is to share possession; it is also the rule of the apostles and the rule of charity that all things should

be had in common. By sharing the gift both giver
